p: These results are consistent with the literature data. Sadurni et al. [ 40] obtained nanoemulsions also stabilized with Cremophor EL (PEG-35 castor oil), on the basis of caprylic and capric triglycerides (Miglyol 812), with a low-energy method. For a water/Cremophor EL/Miglyol 812 system, the nanoemulsion was obtained with an oil:surfactant ratio of 10:90 to 40:60. They had a droplet size between 14 and 39 nm and maintained kinetic stability for 7 months.
